2    |  *  Collected Unix Vector routines

12   | static char Id[]="@(#)$Id: uvec.c.src.html,v 1.1 2009/09/01 20:22:37 rkowen Exp $";
13   | static void *UseId[] = { &UseId, Id };
14   | 
15   | #include <stdlib.h>
16   | #include <stdarg.h>
17   | #include <string.h>
18   | #include <time.h>
19   | #include "modules_def.h"
20   | #ifdef HAVE_STRMALLOC
21   | #  include "strmalloc.h"
22   | #endif
23   | 
24   | char uvec_TAG[5] = "UVEC";
25   | 
26   | /* uvec internal macros */
27   | #define         UVECNEXTLENGTH(x)       (((x)*3)/2)
28   | #define         UVECPREVLENGTH(x)       (((x)*2)/3)
29   | 
30   | 
31   | /* ====================================================================== */
32   | /* === uvec_strfns.c === */
33   | /* uvec.c -
34   |  *  uvec_set_def_strfns
35   |  *  register the set of string functions to use by default.
36   |  *
37   |  *  uvec_get_def_strfns
38   |  *  query  as  to which set of string functions are being used
39   |  *  returns a str_fns *
40   |  *
41   |  *  uvec_set_strfns
42   |  *  register the set of string functions to use for the object
43   |  *  overrides the current set ... don't do this if the object is already
44   |  *  fully defined.
45   |  *
46   |  *  uvec_get_strfns
47   |  *  query  as  to which set of string functions
48   |  *  are being used for the object.
49   |  *  returns a str_fns *
50   |  */
51   | /* wrappers for the StdC string functions
52   |  */
53   | static char *stdc_nmalloc (char const *str, size_t n) {
54   | 	char *out;
55   | 	/* fprintf(stderr, "stdc malloc\n"); */
56   | 	if((out = module_calloc((n+1),sizeof(char))))
57   | 		(void) strncpy(out, str, n);
58   | 	return out;
59   | }
60   | static int stdc_free (char **str) {
61   | 	/* fprintf(stderr, "stdc free\n"); */
62   | 	null_free((void **) str);
63   | 	return 0;
64   | }
65   | 
66   | uvec_str stdc_str_fns = {
67   | 	UVEC_STDC,
68   | 	stdc_nmalloc,
69   | 	stdc_free
70   | };
71   | 
72   | /* ---------------------------------------------------------------------- */
73   | #ifdef HAVE_STRMALLOC
74   | uvec_str strmalloc_str_fns = {
75   | 	UVEC_STRMALLOC,
76   | 	strnmalloc,
77   | 	strfree
78   | };
79   | 
80   | uvec_str default_str_fns = {
81   | 	UVEC_STRMALLOC,
82   | 	strnmalloc,
83   | 	strfree
84   | };
85   | #else
86   | uvec_str default_str_fns = {
87   | 	UVEC_STDC,
88   | 	stdc_nmalloc,
89   | 	stdc_free
90   | };
91   | #endif
92   | /* set the default set of string functions to use
93   |  */
94   | int uvec_set_def_strfns(enum uvec_def_str_fns type, uvec_str *strfns) {
95   | 	if (type == UVEC_DEFAULT) {
96   | #ifdef HAVE_STRMALLOC
97   | 		type = UVEC_STRMALLOC;
98   | #else
99   | 		type = UVEC_STDC;
100  | #endif
101  | 	}
102  | 	if (type == UVEC_STDC) {
103  | 		default_str_fns.str_alloc = stdc_str_fns.str_alloc;
104  | 		default_str_fns.str_free = stdc_str_fns.str_free;
105  | #ifdef HAVE_STRMALLOC
106  | 	} else if (type == UVEC_STRMALLOC) {
107  | 		default_str_fns.str_alloc = strmalloc_str_fns.str_alloc;
108  | 		default_str_fns.str_free = strmalloc_str_fns.str_free;
109  | #endif
110  | 	} else if (type == UVEC_USER) {
111  | 		if (strfns == (uvec_str*) NULL
112  | 		|| strfns->str_alloc == NULL
113  | 		|| strfns->str_free == NULL) {
114  | 			return -1;
115  | 		}
116  | 		default_str_fns.str_alloc = strfns->str_alloc;
117  | 		default_str_fns.str_free = strfns->str_free;
118  | 	}
119  | 	default_str_fns.type = type;
120  | 	return 0;
121  | }
122  | 
123  | /* return what type of string functions are currently default
124  |  */
125  | uvec_str *uvec_get_def_strfns(void) {
126  | 	return &default_str_fns;
127  | }
128  | 
129  | /* set the string functions to use
130  |  */
131  | int uvec_set_strfns(uvec *uv, uvec_str *strfns) {
132  | 	if (!strfns) {
133  | 		return -1;
134  | 	}
135  | 	if (uv) {
136  | 		uv->str_fns.type = strfns->type;
137  | 		uv->str_fns.str_alloc = strfns->str_alloc;
138  | 		uv->str_fns.str_free = strfns->str_free;
139  | 	} else {
140  | 		return -2;
141  | 	}
142  | 	return 0;
143  | }
144  | 
145  | /* return what type of string functions are currently default
146  |  */
147  | uvec_str *uvec_get_strfns(uvec *uv) {
148  | 	if (uvec_exists(uv)) {
149  | 		return &(uv->str_fns);
150  | 	} else {
151  | 		return (uvec_str *) NULL;
152  | 	}
153  | }
154  | 
155  | /* ====================================================================== */
156  | /* === uvec_ctor.c === */
157  | /* uvec.c -
158  |  *  uvec_ctor_     construct  Unix  vector to capacity ``cap''
159  |  *  using the given set of string functions.
160  |  *
161  |  *  uvec_ctor      construct Unix vector to  capacity  ``cap''
162  |  *  using  the default set of string functions.
163  |  */
164  | /* uvec_ctor_ - construct Unix vector to capacity cap and use the
165  |  * given string functions.
166  |  * returns NULL if an error, else the memory location  if OK.
167  |  * uvec_ctor_ will call uvec_init_() to set things up.
168  |  */
169  | uvec *uvec_ctor_(int cap, uvec_str str_fns) {
170  | 	uvec *uv = (uvec *) NULL;
171  | 
172  | 	if ((uvec *) NULL == (uv = uvec_alloc_(str_fns))) {
173  | 		return uv;
174  | 	}
175  | 	if (uvec_init_(uv,cap,str_fns)) {
176  | 		(void) uvec_dealloc(&uv);
177  | 		uv = (uvec *) NULL;
178  | 	}
179  | 	return uv;
180  | }
181  | 
182  | /* uvec_ctor - construct Unix vector to capacity cap
183  |  * uvec_ctor will call uvec_ctor_() to set things up.
184  |  */
185  | uvec *uvec_ctor(int cap) {
186  | 	return uvec_ctor_(cap, default_str_fns);
187  | }
188  | 
189  | 
190  | /* ====================================================================== */
191  | /* === uvec_dtor.c === */
192  | /* uvec.c -
193  |  *  uvec_dtor      destroy the Unix vector and it's  contents.
194  |  */
195  | /* uvec_dtor - destroy the uvec (calls uvec_close also) */
196  | int uvec_dtor(uvec **uv) {
197  | 	int retval = 0;
198  | 	if ((retval = uvec_close(*uv))) return retval;
199  | 	if ((retval = uvec_dealloc(uv))) return retval;
200  | 	return retval;
201  | }
202  | 
203  | 
204  | /* ====================================================================== */
205  | /* === uvec_alloc.c === */
206  | /* uvec.c -
207  |  *  uvec_alloc_    allocate  the uninitialized uvec object (no
208  |  *  vector is allocated) using the given set of
209  |  *  string functions.
210  |  *
211  |  *  uvec_alloc     allocate  the uninitialized uvec object (no
212  |  *  vector is allocated) using the default  set
213  |  *  of string functions.
214  |  */
215  | /* uvec_alloc_ - allocate an unitialized uvec object and use the
216  |  * given string functions.
217  |  * returns NULL if an error, else the memory location  if OK.
218  |  */
219  | uvec *uvec_alloc_(uvec_str strfns) {
220  | 	uvec *uv = (uvec *) NULL;
221  | 
222  | 	if (!(uv = (uvec *) module_malloc(sizeof(uvec)))) {
223  | 		return uv;
224  | 	}
225  | 	uv->str_fns.str_alloc = strfns.str_alloc;
226  | 	uv->str_fns.str_free = strfns.str_free;
227  | 	return uv;
228  | }
229  | 
230  | /* uvec_alloc - allocate an unitialized uvec object
231  |  * set to use the default string functions
232  |  * uvec_alloc will call uvec_alloc_() to set things up.
233  |  */
234  | uvec *uvec_alloc(void) {
235  | 	return uvec_alloc_(default_str_fns);
236  | }
237  | 
238  | 
239  | /* ====================================================================== */
240  | /* === uvec_dealloc.c === */
241  | /* uvec.c -
242  |  *  uvec_dealloc   Deallocate  the  uvec object (vector is not touched)
243  |  *
244  |  */
245  | /* uvec_dealloc - deallocate the unitialized uvec  */
246  | int uvec_dealloc(uvec **uv) {
247  | 	int retval = 0;
248  | 	null_free ((void **) uv);
249  | 	/* *uv = (uvec *) NULL; */
250  | 	return retval;
251  | }
252  | 
253  | /* ====================================================================== */
254  | /* === uvec_init.c === */
255  | /* uvec.c -
256  |  *  uvec_init_     initialize Unix vector to capacity  ``cap''
257  |  *  using the given set of string functions.
258  |  *
259  |  *  uvec_init      initialize  Unix vector to capacity ``cap''
260  |  *  using the default set of string  functions.
261  |  */
262  | /* uvec_init_ - construct Unix vector to capacity cap use the
263  |  * given string functions.
264  |  * returns <0 if an error, else 0 if OK as well as all the other functions
265  |  */
266  | int uvec_init_(uvec *uv, int cap, uvec_str strfns) {
267  | 	if (uv == (uvec *) NULL) {
268  | 		return -1;
269  | 	}
270  | /* can't guarantee that struct will be initialized to 0 hence use "tag" */
271  | 	if (!strncmp(uv->tag,uvec_TAG, 5)) {
272  | 		return -2;
273  | 	}
274  | 	if (cap < 1) {
275  | 		return -3;
276  | 	}
277  | 	if (!(uv->vector = (char **) module_calloc(cap, sizeof(char *)))) {
278  | 		return -4;
279  | 	}
280  | 	(void) strcpy(uv->tag, uvec_TAG);
281  | 	uv->capacity = cap;
282  | 	uv->number = 0;
283  | 	uv->str_fns.type = strfns.type;
284  | 	uv->str_fns.str_alloc = strfns.str_alloc;
285  | 	uv->str_fns.str_free = strfns.str_free;
286  | 	return 0;
287  | }
288  | /* uvec_init_ - construct Unix vector to capacity cap
289  |  * use the default string functions
290  |  * uvec_init will call uvec_init_() to set things up.
291  |  */
292  | int uvec_init(uvec *uv, int cap) {
293  | 	return uvec_init_(uv, cap, default_str_fns);
294  | }
295  | 
296  | /* ====================================================================== */
297  | /* === uvec_close.c === */
298  | /* uvec.c -
299  |  * uvec_close     destroy the Unix vector contents.
300  |  */
301  | /* uvec_close - destroy the uvec contents */
302  | int uvec_close(uvec *uv) {
303  | 	int i;
304  | 
305  | 	if (uv == (uvec *) NULL) {
306  | 		return -1;
307  | 	}
308  | 	*(uv->tag) = '\0';
309  | 	for (i = 0; i < uv->number; ++i) {
310  | 		(uv->str_fns.str_free)(&(uv->vector[i]));
311  | 		uv->vector[i] = (char *) NULL;
312  | 	}
313  | 	null_free((void **) &(uv->vector));
314  | 	/* uv->vector = (char **) NULL; */
315  | 	uv->capacity = 0;
316  | 	uv->number = 0;
317  | 	return 0;
318  | }
319  | 
320  | /* ====================================================================== */
321  | /* === uvec_accessor.c === */
322  | /* uvec.c -
323  |  */
324  | /* accessor functions */
325  | int uvec_exists(uvec const *uv) {
326  | 	int retval = 0;
327  | 	if (uv == (uvec *) NULL) {
328  | 		retval = 0;
329  | 	} else {
330  | 		if (strncmp(uv->tag,uvec_TAG, 5)) {
331  | 			retval = 0;
332  | 		} else {
333  | 			retval = 1;
334  | 		}
335  | 	}
336  | 	return retval;
337  | }
338  | 
339  | int uvec_capacity(uvec const *uv) {
340  | 	if (uvec_exists(uv)) {
341  | 		return uv->capacity;
342  | 	} else {
343  | 		return -1;
344  | 	}
345  | }
346  | 
347  | int uvec_number(uvec const *uv) {
348  | 	if (uvec_exists(uv)) {
349  | 		return uv->number;
350  | 	} else {
351  | 		return -1;
352  | 	}
353  | }
354  | 
355  | int uvec_end(uvec const *uv) {
356  | 	if (uvec_exists(uv)) {
357  | 		return uv->number - 1;
358  | 	} else {
359  | 		return -1;
360  | 	}
361  | }
362  | 
363  | char ** uvec_vector(uvec const *uv) {
364  | 	if (uvec_exists(uv)) {
365  | 		return uv->vector;
366  | 	} else {
367  | 		return (char **) NULL;
368  | 	}
369  | }
370  | 
371  | 
372  | /* ====================================================================== */
373  | /* === uvec_insert.c === */
374  | /* uvec.c -
375  |  *  uvec_insert    insert an element before element ``place''.
376  |  *
377  |  *  uvec_ninsert   insert an element of size n before  element ``place''.
378  |  *
379  |  *  uvec_delete    delete an element at element ``place''.
380  |  *
381  |  */
382  | /* uvec_increase - internal function to increase the size of vector
383  |  * if newcap <= 0 then increase by default size else compute  new capacity
384  |  */
385  | static int uvec_increase(uvec *uv, int newcap) {
386  | 	int i;
387  | 
388  | 	newcap = (newcap <= 0 ? UVECNEXTLENGTH(uv->capacity) : newcap);
389  | 	if (!(uv->vector = (char **) module_realloc(uv->vector,
390  | 		newcap*sizeof(char *)))) {
391  | 		return -1;
392  | 	}
393  | 	uv->capacity = newcap;
394  | 	/* zero out extra capacity */
395  | 	for (i = uv->number; i < uv->capacity; ++i)
396  | 		uv->vector[i] = (char *) NULL;
397  | 	return 0;
398  | }
399  | /* ---------------------------------------------------------------------- */
400  | /* uvec_decrease - internal function to decrease the size of vector
401  |  * if newcap <= 0 then decrease by default size else compute  new capacity
402  |  */
403  | static int uvec_decrease(uvec *uv, int newcap) {
404  | 
405  | 	newcap = (newcap <= 0 ? UVECPREVLENGTH(uv->capacity) : newcap);
406  | 	if (!(uv->vector = (char **) module_realloc(uv->vector,
407  | 		newcap*sizeof(char *)))) {
408  | 		return -1;
409  | 	}
410  | 	uv->capacity = newcap;
411  | 	return 0;
412  | }
413  | 
414  | /* uvec_nmalloc - str_alloc & copy a string to element "place"
415  |  * assume no element exists there yet and you have the capacity.
416  |  */
417  | static int uvec_nmalloc(uvec *uv, char const *str, size_t n, int place) {
418  | 	if (place < 0 || place >= uv->capacity) {
419  | 		return -1;
420  | 	}
421  | 	if (!(uv->vector[place] = (uv->str_fns.str_alloc)(str,n))) {
422  | 		return -2;
423  | 	}
424  | 	return 0;
425  | }
426  | 
427  | /* uvec_shift_vec - internal function to shift part of the vector */
428  | /* if start <= 0, then set start=0  (start of vector)
429  |  * if end   <= 0, then set end=number (end of vector)
430  |  * newstart = where to put the range of vector
431  |  * everything between start & newstart is zeroed and assumed to be
432  |  *
433  |  * note 'end' = first element after the last element to move
434  |  */
435  | static int uvec_shift_vec(uvec *uv, int start, int end, int newstart) {
436  | 	register int i;
437  | 	int n;
438  | 	int rstat;
439  | 
440  | 	if (start <= 0) start = 0;
441  | 	if (end <= 0) end = uv->number;
442  | 	if (newstart < 0) {
443  | 		return -1;
444  | 	}
445  | 	if (start > uv->number) {
446  | 		return -2;
447  | 	}
448  | 	if (end > uv->number || end < start) {
449  | 		return -3;
450  | 	}
451  | 	if (newstart == start) {	/* do nothing */
452  | 		return 0;
453  | 	}
454  | 	if (newstart < start) {			/* shift upwards */
455  | 		for (i = newstart; i < start; ++i) {
456  | 			/* dealloc elements */
457  | 			(uv->str_fns.str_free)(&(uv->vector[i]));
458  | 		}
459  | 		for (i = start; i < end; ++i) {
460  | 			uv->vector[newstart++] = uv->vector[i];
461  | 			uv->vector[i] = (char *) NULL;
462  | 		}
463  | 	} else {				/* shift downwards */
464  | 		n = newstart + end - start;
465  | 		if (n >= uv->capacity) {
466  | 			/* increase capacity */
467  | 			if ((rstat = uvec_increase(uv,
468  | 				(n>UVECNEXTLENGTH(uv->capacity)
469  | 				? n :  UVECNEXTLENGTH(uv->capacity))))) {
470  | 				return rstat - 128;
471  | 			}
472  | 		}
473  | 		for (i = end; i < n; ++i) {
474  | 			/* dealloc elements */
475  | 			(uv->str_fns.str_free)(&(uv->vector[i]));
476  | 			uv->vector[i] = (char *) NULL;
477  | 		}
478  | 		for (i = end - 1; i >= start; --i) {
479  | 			uv->vector[--n] = uv->vector[i];
480  | 			uv->vector[i] = (char *) NULL;
481  | 		}
482  | 	}
483  | 	return 0;
484  | }
485  | /* ---------------------------------------------------------------------- */
486  | /* uvec_ninsert - insert an element of length n before element "place"
487  |  */
488  | int uvec_ninsert(uvec *uv, char const *str, size_t n, int place) {
489  | 	int rstat;
490  | 
491  | 	if (place < 0 || place > uv->number) {
492  | 		return -1;
493  | 	}
494  | 	if ((rstat = uvec_shift_vec(uv, place, 0, place + 1))) {
495  | 		return rstat - 128;
496  | 	}
497  | 	if ((rstat = uvec_nmalloc(uv, str, n, place))) {
498  | 		return rstat - 128;
499  | 	}
500  | 	++(uv->number);
501  | 	return 0;
502  | }
503  | /* ---------------------------------------------------------------------- */
504  | /* uvec_insert - insert an element before element "place"
505  |  */
506  | int uvec_insert(uvec *uv, char const *str, int place) {
507  | 
508  | 	if (! str ) {
509  | 		return -1;
510  | 	}
511  | 	return uvec_ninsert(uv, str, strlen(str)+1, place);
512  | }
513  | 
514  | /* ---------------------------------------------------------------------- */
515  | /* uvec_delete - delete an element at element "place"
516  |  */
517  | int uvec_delete(uvec *uv, int place) {
518  | 	int rstat;
519  | 
520  | 	if (uv->number <= 0) {
521  | 		return -1;
522  | 	}
523  | 	if (place < 0 || place > uv->number - 1) {
524  | 		return -2;
525  | 	}
526  | 	if ((rstat = uvec_shift_vec(uv, place + 1, 0, place))) {
527  | 		return rstat - 128;
528  | 	}
529  | 	--(uv->number);
530  | 	(uv->str_fns.str_free)(&(uv->vector[uv->number]));
531  | 	uv->vector[uv->number] = (char *) NULL;
532  | 
533  | 	if (uv->number < uv->capacity/2) {
534  | 		if ((rstat = uvec_decrease(uv, 0))) {
535  | 			return rstat - 128;
536  | 		}
537  | 	}
538  | 	return 0;
539  | }
540  | 
541  | /* ====================================================================== */
542  | /* === uvec_add.c === */
543  | /* uvec.c -
544  |  *  uvec_add       add one element to end of vector.
545  |  *
546  |  *  uvec_nadd      add one element of size n to end of vector.
547  |  *
548  |  *  uvec_addl      add a NULL terminated list of  elements  to
549  |  *                 end of vector.
550  |  */
551  | /* uvec_add - add 1 element to end of vector */
552  | int uvec_add(uvec *uv, char const *str) {
553  | 
554  | 	if (! str ) {
555  | 		return -1;
556  | 	}
557  | 	return uvec_nadd(uv, str, strlen(str)+1);
558  | }
559  | 
560  | /* ---------------------------------------------------------------------- */
561  | /* uvec_nadd - add 1 element of size n to end of vector */
562  | int uvec_nadd(uvec *uv, char const *str, size_t n) {
563  | 	int rstat;
564  | 	if ((rstat = uvec_ninsert(uv, str, n, uv->number))) {
565  | 		return rstat - 128;
566  | 	}
567  | 
568  | 	return 0;
569  | } 
570  | 
571  | /* ---------------------------------------------------------------------- */
572  | /* uvec_addl - add a variable number of elements (terminated by a NULL
573  |  *	argument) to end of vector
574  |  */
575  | int uvec_addl(uvec *uv, ...) {
576  | 	int rstat;
577  | 	const char *str;
578  | 	va_list ap;
579  | 
580  | 	va_start(ap, uv);
581  | 	while ((str = va_arg(ap, const char *))) {
582  | 		if ((rstat = uvec_add(uv, str))) {
583  | 			return rstat - 128;
584  | 		}
585  | 	}
586  | 	va_end(ap);
587  | 	return 0;
588  | }
589  | 
590  | 
591  | /* ====================================================================== */
592  | /* === uvec_push.c === */
593  | /* uvec.c -
594  |  *  uvec_push      same as uvec_add
595  |  *
596  |  *  uvec_pop       pop off one element at end of vector.
597  |  */
598  | /* uvec_push - add 1 element to end of vector (same as uvec_add) */
599  | int uvec_push(uvec *uv, char const *str) {
600  | 	return uvec_add(uv,str);
601  | }
602  | /* ---------------------------------------------------------------------- */
603  | /* uvec_pop - pop off 1 element at end of vector
604  |  *	and delete it
605  |  */ 	
606  | int uvec_pop(uvec *uv) {
607  | 	int rstat;
608  | 	if ((rstat = uvec_delete(uv, uv->number - 1))) {
609  | 		return rstat - 128;
610  | 	}
611  | 
612  | 	return 0;
613  | }
614  | 
615  | /* ====================================================================== */
616  | /* === uvec_shift.c === */
617  | /* uvec.c -
618  |  *  uvec_unshift   add one element to start of vector.
619  |  *
620  |  *  uvec_shift     shift one element from start of vector.
621  |  */
622  | /* uvec_unshift - add 1 element to the beginning of vector */
623  | int uvec_unshift(uvec *uv, char const *str) {
624  | 	int rstat;
625  | 
626  | 	if (! str ) {
627  | 		return -1;
628  | 	}
629  | 	if ((rstat = uvec_ninsert(uv, str, strlen(str)+1, 0))) {
630  | 		return rstat - 128;
631  | 	}
632  | 
633  | 	return 0;
634  | }
635  | /* ---------------------------------------------------------------------- */
636  | /* uvec_shift - shift off 1 element at the beginning of vector
637  |  *	and delete it
638  |  */ 	
639  | int uvec_shift(uvec *uv) {
640  | 	int rstat;
641  | 	if ((rstat = uvec_delete(uv, 0))) {
642  | 		return rstat - 128;
643  | 	}
644  | 
645  | 	return 0;
646  | }
647  | 
648  | /* ====================================================================== */
649  | /* === uvec_count_tok.c === */
650  | /* uvec.c -
651  |  *  uvec_copy_str *  create a uvec from a token delimited string.
652  |  *  Tokens escaped with a '\' are not counted.
653  |  */
654  | /* some useful functions ...
655  |  * note that all these use no direct access to the structure
656  |  * and form an example set of how to use uvec */
657  | /* ---------------------------------------------------------------------- */
658  | 
659  | /* uvec_count_tok - returns the number of token delimited elements
660  |  * 	in a string (trailing following token is optional)
661  |  * 	returns -1 if an error
662  |  * 	'\' before the token escapes it
663  |  * 	... but it's still possible to confuse the count
664  |  */
665  | int uvec_count_tok(char const *token, char const *string) {
666  | 	int num = 0;
667  | 	int toklen = 0;
668  | 	const char *ptr = string;
669  | 	const char *tokptr;
670  | 
671  | 	if (! string)	return 0;
672  | 	if (! *string)	return 0;
673  | 	if (! token)	return -1;	/* gotta supply a token */
674  | 	if (! *token)	return -1;
675  | 	toklen = strlen(token);
676  | 	if (! toklen)	return -1;
677  | 	while (*ptr) {
678  | 		num++;
679  | 		tokptr = strstr(ptr, token);
680  | 		if (! tokptr ) break;
681  | 		if ( tokptr > string) {
682  | 			if (*(tokptr-1) == '\\') num--;
683  | 		}
684  | 		ptr = tokptr + toklen;
685  | 	}
686  | 
687  | 	return num;
688  | }
689  | 
690  | 
691  | /* ====================================================================== */
692  | /* === uvec_copy_str.c === */
693  | /* uvec.c -
694  |  * uvec_copy_str create a uvec from a token delimited string.
695  |  * Tokens escaped with a '\' are not counted.
696  |  */
697  | /* uvec_copy_str - create a uvec from a token delimited string
698  |  * 	'\' before the token escapes it
699  |  * 	... but it's still possible to confuse the count
700  |  */
701  | int uvec_copy_str(uvec *u, char const *token, char const *string) {
702  | 	int num = uvec_count_tok(token,string);
703  | 	const char *ptr = string;
704  | 	const char *tokptr;
705  | 	int toklen = strlen(token);
706  | 	int tokfound = 0;
707  | 	int rstat;
708  | 	size_t fraglen;
709  | 
710  | 	if (num < 0) {
711  | 		return -1;
712  | 	}
713  | 
714  | #if 0
715  | 	if (! string) {
716  | 		return -2;
717  | 	}
718  | #endif
719  | 
720  | 	if ((rstat = uvec_init(u, num + 1))) {
721  | 		return rstat - 128;
722  | 	}
723  | 
724  | 	while (ptr && *ptr) {
725  | 		tokptr = ptr;
726  | 		while (! tokfound) {
727  | 			tokptr = strstr(tokptr, token);
728  | 			if (tokptr && (tokptr > string)) {
729  | 				if (*(tokptr-1) != '\\') {
730  | 					tokfound = 1;
731  | 				} else {
732  | 					tokptr++;
733  | 					continue;
734  | 				}
735  | 			}
736  | 			if ((tokptr == string) || !tokptr) tokfound = 1;
737  | 		}
738  | 		tokfound = 0;
739  | 		if (! tokptr ) {
740  | 			if ((rstat = uvec_add(u, ptr))) {
741  | 				return rstat - 128;
742  | 			}
743  | 			break;
744  | 		} else {
745  | 			/* add 1 to length and set last char to \0 */
746  | 			fraglen = tokptr - ptr;
747  | 			uvec_nadd(u, ptr, fraglen + 1);
748  | 			ptr = uvec_vector(u)[uvec_end(u)];
749  | 			*((char *) ptr + fraglen) = '\0';
750  | 		}
751  | 		ptr = tokptr + toklen;
752  | 	}
753  | 
754  | 	return 0;
755  | }
756  | 
757  | 
758  | /* ====================================================================== */
759  | /* === uvec_copy_vec.c === */
760  | /* uvec.c -
761  |  *  uvec_copy_vec  copy   an   existing   char  vector  to  an
762  |  *  unitialized uvec.  Set num to a value  less
763  |  *  than  or equal to 0 to grab the entire vector.
764  |  */
765  | /* uvec_copy_vec - copy an existing vector to an unitialized uvec */
766  | int uvec_copy_vec(uvec *u, char const * const *vec, int number) {
767  | 	int rstat;
768  | 	char  const * const *ptr = vec;
769  | 	int num = 0;
770  | 	if (number <= 0) {
771  | /* count number in vector (add 1) */
772  | 		while (*ptr++) ++num;
773  | 		number = ++num;
774  | 	}
775  | 
776  | 	if ((rstat = uvec_init_(u, number,u->str_fns))) {
777  | 		return rstat - 128;
778  | 	}
779  | 	for (ptr = vec; *ptr != (char *)NULL; ++ptr) {
780  | 		if ((rstat = uvec_add(u, *ptr))) {
781  | 			return rstat - 128;
782  | 		}
783  | 	}
784  | 	return 0;
785  | }
786  | 
787  | 
788  | /* ====================================================================== */
789  | /* === uvec_copy.c === */
790  | /* uvec.c -
791  |  *  uvec_copy      copy one uvec to another unitialized one.
792  |  */
793  | /* uvec_copy - copy one uvec to another unitialized one */
794  | int uvec_copy(uvec *u, uvec const *v) {
795  | 	int rstat;
796  | 
797  | 	if ((rstat = uvec_copy_vec(u, (char const * const *) uvec_vector(v),
798  | 					uvec_capacity(v)))) {
799  | 		return rstat - 128;
800  | 	}
801  | 	return 0;
802  | }
803  | 
804  | 
805  | /* ====================================================================== */
806  | /* === uvec_sort.c === */
807  | /* uvec.c -
808  |  *  uvec_sort sort the vector, given the following types:
809  |  *  UVEC_ASCEND, UVEC_DESCEND,
810  |  *  UVEC_CASE_ASCEND, UVEC_CASE_DESCEND,  where
811  |  *  the last two are only available if the str­
812  |  *  casecmp function is available  for  ``case­
813  |  *  less'' string comparisons.
814  |  *
815  |  *  uvec_qsort sort the vector, according to the passed comparison function,
816  |  *  which is of the same type as needed by qsort()
817  |  *  namely int cmp(void const *a, void const *b)
818  |  *
819  |  *  uvec_find find the first or last element that matches
820  |  *  the string str depending on the  sort  type
821  |  *  and  returns  the  element  number.  If the
822  |  *  string is not found  then  returns  -1.   A
823  |  *  value  less  than  -1  indicates  an error,
824  |  *  which probably can be ignored.  type = uvec
825  |  *  sorting type.
826  |  *
827  |  *  uvec_uniq remove  all  adjacent  duplicate  elements,
828  |  *  where type =  uvec  sorting  type  ...  the
829  |  *  important  information  is whether to use a
830  |  *  caseless comparison or not, but  there  may
831  |  *  be subtle side effects depending on whether
832  |  *  the sort type is ascending or descending.
833  |  */
834  | /* comparison functions */
835  | 
836  | static int uvec_sort_cmp_ascend(void const *a, void const *b) {
837  | 	return strcmp(*(char **) a, *(char **) b);
838  | }
839  | 
840  | static int uvec_sort_cmp_descend(void const *a, void const *b) {
841  | 	return strcmp(*(char **) b, *(char **) a);
842  | }
843  | 
844  | #ifdef HAVE_STRCASECMP
845  | static int uvec_sort_cmp_case_ascend(void const *a, void const *b) {
846  | 	return strcasecmp(*(char **) a, *(char **) b);
847  | }
848  | 
849  | static int uvec_sort_cmp_case_descend(void const *a, void const *b) {
850  | 	return strcasecmp(*(char **) b, *(char **) a);
851  | }
852  | #endif /* HAVE_STRCASECMP */
853  | 
854  | /* ---------------------------------------------------------------------- */
855  | /* uvec_sort - sort the vector */
856  | 
857  | int uvec_sort(uvec *uv, enum uvec_order type) {
858  | 	int (*cmp)(void const *, void const *);
859  | 	if (!uvec_exists(uv)) {
860  | 		return -1;
861  | 	}
862  | 	if (uvec_number(uv) > 0) {
863  | 		switch (type) {
864  | 		case UVEC_ASCEND:
865  | 			cmp = uvec_sort_cmp_ascend;
866  | 			break;
867  | 		case UVEC_DESCEND:
868  | 			cmp = uvec_sort_cmp_descend;
869  | 			break;
870  | #ifdef HAVE_STRCASECMP
871  | 		case UVEC_CASE_ASCEND:
872  | 			cmp = uvec_sort_cmp_case_ascend;
873  | 			break;
874  | 		case UVEC_CASE_DESCEND:
875  | 			cmp = uvec_sort_cmp_case_descend;
876  | 			break;
877  | #endif /* HAVE_STRCASECMP */
878  | 		default:
879  | 			return -2;
880  | 		}
881  | 	}
882  | 	uvec_qsort(uv, cmp);
883  | 	return 0;
884  | }
885  | 
886  | /* ---------------------------------------------------------------------- */
887  | /* uvec_qsort - sort the vector */
888  | 
889  | int uvec_qsort(uvec *uv,  int (*cmp)(void const *a, void const *b)) {
890  | 	int retval = -1;
891  | 	if (uvec_exists(uv) && cmp) {
892  | 		qsort((void *) uvec_vector(uv), (size_t) uvec_number(uv),
893  | 			sizeof(char *), cmp);
894  | 		return 0;
895  | 	} else {
896  | 		return retval;
897  | 	}
898  | }
899  | 
900  | /* ---------------------------------------------------------------------- */
901  | /* uvec_find - finds the first or last entry in a vector that matches
902  |  * 	the string given the uvec sorting type.
903  |  */
904  | 
905  | int uvec_find(uvec *uv, char const *str, enum uvec_order type) {
906  | 	int i = 0;
907  | 	char **vec;
908  | 	int (*cmp)(void const *, void const *);
909  | 
910  | 
911  | 	if (!uvec_exists(uv)) {
912  | 		return -2;
913  | 	}
914  | 	if (uvec_number(uv) > 0) {
915  | 		switch (type) {
916  | 		case UVEC_ASCEND:
917  | 			cmp = uvec_sort_cmp_descend;
918  | 			break;
919  | 		case UVEC_DESCEND:
920  | 			cmp = uvec_sort_cmp_ascend;
921  | 			break;
922  | #ifdef HAVE_STRCASECMP
923  | 		case UVEC_CASE_ASCEND:
924  | 			cmp = uvec_sort_cmp_case_descend;
925  | 			break;
926  | 		case UVEC_CASE_DESCEND:
927  | 			cmp = uvec_sort_cmp_case_ascend;
928  | 			break;
929  | #endif /* HAVE_STRCASECMP */
930  | 		default:	/* assume case sensitive */
931  | 			cmp = uvec_sort_cmp_ascend;
932  | 		}
933  | 	}
934  | 	while (*(vec = (uvec_vector(uv) + i))) {
935  | 		if (!(*cmp)(vec,  &str)) return i;
936  | 		i++;
937  | 	}
938  | 	return -1;	/* string not found */
939  | }
940  | 
941  | /* ---------------------------------------------------------------------- */
942  | /* uvec_uniq - remove all adjacent duplicate elements
943  |  *	type = uvec sorting type ... the import information is whether
944  |  *	to use a caseless comparison or not.
945  |  */
946  | int uvec_uniq(uvec *uv, enum uvec_order type) {
947  | 	int i = 1;
948  | 	char **vec;
949  | 	int (*cmp)(void const *, void const *);
950  | 
951  | 	if (!uvec_exists(uv)) {
952  | 		return -1;
953  | 	}
954  | 	if (uvec_number(uv) > 1) {
955  | 		switch (type) {
956  | 		case UVEC_ASCEND:
957  | 			cmp = uvec_sort_cmp_ascend;
958  | 			break;
959  | 		case UVEC_DESCEND:
960  | 			cmp = uvec_sort_cmp_descend;
961  | 			break;
962  | #ifdef HAVE_STRCASECMP
963  | 		case UVEC_CASE_ASCEND:
964  | 			cmp = uvec_sort_cmp_case_ascend;
965  | 			break;
966  | 		case UVEC_CASE_DESCEND:
967  | 			cmp = uvec_sort_cmp_case_descend;
968  | 			break;
969  | #endif /* HAVE_STRCASECMP */
970  | 		default:
971  | 			return -2;
972  | 		}
973  | 		while (*(vec = (uvec_vector(uv) + i))) {
974  | 			if ((*cmp)(vec, (vec - 1))) {
975  | 				i++;			/* go to next */
976  | 			} else {
977  | 				uvec_delete(uv,i);	/* found match */
978  | 			}
979  | 		}
980  | 	}
981  | 	return 0;
982  | }
983  | 
984  | /* ====================================================================== */
985  | /* === uvec_reverse.c === */
986  | /* uvec.c -
987  |  * uvec_reverse   reverses the element order of the vector.
988  |  */
989  | /* uvec_reverse - reverses the element order of the vector */
990  | int uvec_reverse(uvec const *uv) {
991  | 	int num;
992  | 	char **ptrstart, **ptrend;
993  | 	char *swap;
994  | 	if (!uvec_exists(uv)) {
995  | 	}
996  | 	num = uvec_number(uv);
997  | 	if (num > 1) {		/* do reversal */
998  | 		ptrstart = uvec_vector(uv);
999  | 		ptrend = ptrstart + uvec_end(uv);
1000 | 		while (ptrstart < ptrend) {
1001 | 			swap = *ptrend;
1002 | 			*ptrend-- = *ptrstart;
1003 | 			*ptrstart++ = swap;
1004 | 		}
1005 | 	}
1006 | 	return 0;
1007 | }
1008 | 
1009 | /* ====================================================================== */
1010 | /* === uvec_randomize.c === */
1011 | /* uvec.c -
1012 |  *  uvec_randomize randomizes the vector, will  be  repeatable
1013 |  *  if  given  the same random number seed.  If
1014 |  *  seed <=0 then will "randomly" choose one.
1015 |  */
1016 | /* wrappers for StdC rand functions to conform to librko - urand
1017 |  *	if not available
1018 |  */
1019 | #if !defined(HAVE_URAND)
1020 | static double urand (void) {
1021 | 	return ((double) rand())/(((double) RAND_MAX) + 1);
1022 | }
1023 | static void setseed(int seed) {
1024 | 	srand((unsigned int) seed);
1025 | }
1026 | #endif
1027 | 
1028 | /* ---------------------------------------------------------------------- */
1029 | /* uvec_randomize - randomizes the vector  - will be deterministic if
1030 |  * use the same seed, However, if seed<=0 then will "randomly"
1031 |  * choose one.
1032 |  */
1033 | int uvec_randomize(uvec const *uv, int seed) {
1034 | 	char *swap;
1035 | 	char **vec, **ptr1, **ptr2;
1036 | 	int num, i;
1037 | 
1038 | 	if (!uvec_exists(uv)) {
1039 | 		return -1;
1040 | 	}
1041 | 	if (seed <=0) {
1042 | 		seed = (int) time(NULL);
1043 | 	}
1044 | 	if (seed < 0) {
1045 | 		return -2;
1046 | 	}
1047 | 	setseed(seed);
1048 | 	num = uvec_number(uv);
1049 | 	vec = uvec_vector(uv);
1050 | 	/* make 3*number of swaps */
1051 | 	for (i = 0; i < 3*num; ++i) {
1052 | 		ptr1 = vec + (int) (num*urand());
1053 | 		ptr2 = vec + (int) (num*urand());
1054 | 		swap = *ptr1;
1055 | 		*ptr1 = *ptr2;
1056 | 		*ptr2 = swap;
1057 | 	}
1058 | 	return 0;
1059 | }
1060 | 
1061 | /* ====================================================================== */
1062 | /* === str2uvec.c === */
1063 | /* uvec.c -
1064 |  *  str2uvec copies a string to  a  uvec,  breaking  the
1065 |  *  string  at  the  given  delimiter, uses the
1066 |  *  default string functions for  creating  the uvec.
1067 |  *
1068 |  */
1069 | /* A bunch of conversion routines
1070 |  */
1071 | /* str2uvec - converts a tokenized string to a uvec
1072 |  *	- outputs a uvec object ptr else NULL
1073 |  */
1074 | uvec *str2uvec(char const *token, char const *string) {
1075 | 	int num = uvec_count_tok(token,string);
1076 | 	uvec *tmp = (uvec *) NULL;
1077 | 
1078 | 	if (num < 0) {
1079 | 		return tmp;
1080 | 	}
1081 | 
1082 | #if 0
1083 | 	if (! string) {
1084 | 		return tmp;
1085 | 	}
1086 | #endif
1087 | 	if (! token) {
1088 | 		return tmp;
1089 | 	}
1090 | 	if ((uvec *) NULL != (tmp = uvec_alloc())) {
1091 | 		if (uvec_copy_str(tmp, token, string)) {
1092 | 			(void) uvec_dealloc(&tmp);
1093 | 			return (uvec *) NULL;
1094 | 		}
1095 | 	}
1096 | 	return tmp;
1097 | }
1098 | 
1099 | 
1100 | /* ====================================================================== */
1101 | /* === vec2uvec.c === */
1102 | /* uvec.c -
1103 |  *  vec2uvec copies  a  vector (or part of a vector upto
1104 |  *  num elements) to a uvec, uses  the  default
1105 |  *  string  functions  for  creating  the uvec.
1106 |  *  Set num to a value less than or equal to  0
1107 |  *  to grab the entire vector.
1108 |  */
1109 | /* vec2uvec - converts a vector into a uvec
1110 |  *	- outputs a uvec object ptr else NULL
1111 |  */
1112 | uvec *vec2uvec(char const * const *vec, int num) {
1113 | 	uvec *tmp = (uvec *) NULL;
1114 | 
1115 | 	if ((uvec *) NULL != (tmp = uvec_alloc())) {
1116 | 		if (uvec_copy_vec(tmp, vec, num)) {
1117 | 			(void) uvec_dealloc(&tmp);
1118 | 			return (uvec *) NULL;
1119 | 		}
1120 | 	}
1121 | 	return tmp;
1122 | }
1123 | 
1124 | /* ====================================================================== */
1125 | /* === uvec2uvec.c === */
1126 | /* uvec.c -
1127 |  *   uvec2uvec      copies  a  uvec  to a uvec uses the default
1128 |  *                  string functions for creating the uvec.
1129 |  */
1130 | /* uvec2uvec - copies a uvec into a uvec
1131 |  *	- outputs a uvec object ptr else NULL
1132 |  */
1133 | uvec *uvec2uvec(uvec const *uv) {
1134 | 	uvec *tmp = (uvec *) NULL;
1135 | 
1136 | 	if ((uvec *) NULL != (tmp = uvec_alloc())) {
1137 | 		if (uvec_copy(tmp, uv)) {
1138 | 			(void) uvec_dealloc(&tmp);
1139 | 			return (uvec *) NULL;
1140 | 		}
1141 | 	}
1142 | 	return tmp;
1143 | }
1144 | 
1145 | /* ====================================================================== */
1146 | /* === uvec2str.c === */
1147 | /* uvec.c -
1148 |  *  uvec2str       copies a uvec to a string with the elements
1149 |  *  separated  by the given delimeter, uses the
1150 |  *  default string functions for  creating  the uvec.
1151 |  */
1152 | /* uvec2str - copies a uvec into a strmalloc object
1153 |  *	- outputs a (char *) ptr else NULL
1154 |  */
1155 | char *uvec2str(uvec const *uv, char const *token) {
1156 | 	char **argv;
1157 | 	char *tmp = (char *) NULL;
1158 | 	int i,len = 0, toklen = strlen(token);
1159 | 
1160 | 	if (! token) {
1161 | 		return tmp;
1162 | 	}
1163 | 	
1164 | 	if (uvec_exists(uv)) {
1165 | 		argv = uvec_vector(uv);
1166 | 		/* count the total length */
1167 | 		for (i = 0; *argv != (char *) NULL; ++i, ++argv) {
1168 | 			if (i) len += toklen;
1169 | 			len += strlen(*argv);
1170 | 		}
1171 | 		/* alloc space */
1172 | 		if ((char *) NULL==(tmp=(uv->str_fns.str_alloc)("", len + 1))) {
1173 | 			return tmp;
1174 | 		}
1175 | 		/* copy stuff over */
1176 | 		argv = uvec_vector(uv);
1177 | 		for (i = 0; *argv != (char *) NULL; ++i, ++argv) {
1178 | 			if (i) strcat(tmp, token);
1179 | 			strcat(tmp, *argv);
1180 | 		}
1181 | 	}
1182 | 	return tmp;
1183 | }
1184 | 
1185 | /* ====================================================================== */
1186 | /* === uvec_strfree.c === */
1187 | /* uvec.c -
1188 |  *  uvec_strfree       free a uvec2str allocated string
1189 |  */
1190 | /* uvec_strfree - free a uvec2str allocated string
1191 |  *	- returns 0 if OK
1192 |  */
1193 | int uvec_strfree(uvec const *uv, char **str) {
1194 | 	int retval = 0;
1195 | 
1196 | 	/* no string to dealloc */
1197 | 	if (! str) return retval;
1198 | 	
1199 | 	if (uvec_exists(uv)) {
1200 | 		/* free string */
1201 | 		if ((retval=(uv->str_fns.str_free)(str))) {
1202 | 		}
1203 | 	} else {
1204 | 		retval = -1;
1205 | 	}
1206 | 	return retval;
1207 | }
1208 |
